channel.title: Comments on: Ruby, Rails and The Art of Software Development

item.title: by: Ruby on Rails Presentation — Audio [@lesscode.org]
item.description: [...] Couple of months ago I’ve posted links to my presentation on Ruby on Rails. Finally, after some deliberation, they posted the audio (about one hour in length). [...]
item.content:encoded: […] Couple of months ago I’ve posted links to my presentation on Ruby on Rails. Finally, after some deliberation, they posted the audio (about one hour in length). […]

item.title: by: Alex Bunardzic
item.description:
Ryan Tomayko:

These slides are very good, Alex. You should try to get audio next time.

Thanks Ryan. Goes without saying that a lot of my philosophy expressed in there was partially inspired by your seminal Motherhood and Apple Pie essay. So my hat goes off to you for formulating and articulating such a cogent set of views!

I will try and get the audio/video, even if I have to pry it out of the organizers' hands. The actual meat of the presentation is not included in my slides, because after the introductory presentation, I demoed my development philosophy using my product ScenicRoute which plugs into Ruby on Rails.

Hopefully more about that soon...
